additional_citations:
Perrigault M, Allam B. (2009). Cytotoxicity of Quahog Parasite Unknown (QPX) toward hard clam (Mercenaria mercenaria) haemocytes and interactions between different pathogen isolates and host strains. Parasitology 136: 1281-1289.
Perrigault M, Bugge DM., Allam B. (2010). Effect of environmental factors on survival and growth of quahog parasite unknown (QPX) in vitro. Journal of Invertebrate Pathology 104: 83-89.
other_experimental_metadata_available: Isolate grown in 25 cm2 culture flasks in ambient air
primary_citation: Qian H., Liu Q., Allam B., Collier J.L. (2007). Molecular genetic variation within and among isolates of QPX (Thraustochytridae), a parasite of the hard clam (Mercenaria mercenaria). Diseases of Aquatic Organisms 77: 159-168.
modifications_to_growth_medium: supplemented with 2% extracts of clam muscle tissue homogenates
importance: The thraustochytrid known as QPX (Quahog Parasite Unknown) has caused significant disease and mortality in aquacultured and wild populations of the hard clam Mercenaria mercenaria along the east coast of North America since the 1950?s. Available knowledge on QPX is extremely limited. Generated new sequence data will allow the identification of factors involved in QPX virulence and pathogenicity offering a better understanding of conditions affecting the occurrence of disease outbreaks.
growth_medium: Minimal Essential Medium with 10% fetal bovine serum
